Insurers to stay with key benefits of US health law

The largest insurers in Mass. have pledged to extend two popular provisions of the Affordable Care Act even if the Supreme Court decides to overturn the law. (Globe)
  • Possible outcomes in pivotal health care law case

Egypt military to hand over power soon

Egypt's official news agency quotes a military council member as saying power will be handed over to the newly elected president by month's end. (AP, 7:39 a.m.)
  • Militants cross into Israel from Egypt, 1 killed

2012 notable deaths: Rodney King, more

King (top), whose 1991 beating by Los Angeles police officers led to destructive race riots, has died. Click through for more notable deaths from this year.
  • Story: Rodney King dies | Sign the guest book

Connolly hopes to be exonerated

Imprisoned former FBI agent John J. Connolly Jr. (pictured) believes he might be exonerated by information that James "Whitey" Bulger has revealed since the reputed mobster's arrest last June. (Boston Globe)

City considers hike in retirees’ pensions

In Boston, a fight over raising municipal pensions seems to be at odds with a nation that has taken aim at public employee benefits. (Globe)

Longer sentence sought for rapist

Michael Johnson could be freed decades earlier than expected after an appeals court last year threw out his 2003 conviction in another case. (Globe)
  • 8/6/10: South End man faces life in prison for assaults
